questions.question: Where is Georgia located?

choices.answer: Southeastern United States AND the Western Hemisphere

questions.question: What region runs from Virginia southwest to northeastern Georgia?
What is used to separate the Piedmont region and the Coastal Plain region?

choices.answer: Never going to the other side or you'll turn out like them

questions.question: What is federalism?

choices.answer: Division of power between the president and the governor
How each branch checks each other
Division of power between the central and state government

questions.question: Which of these is an example of the qualification to vote?

choices.answer: A citizen of the United States
A legal resident of Georgia and the county they wish to vote

questions.question: What is the purpose of a political party?

choices.answer: Contact elected officials hoping to influence them to vote

questions.question: Which of the following describes a census?
What is the president pro tempore's responsibility?

choices.answer: Acts as president of the Senate
Guesses the ages of every citizen in Georgia

questions.question: If a bill came from the Senate, what is the second step of the process?

choices.answer: Rant on which flavor of cake you like
House decides whether the bill can be passed to the Senate
President vetoes or passes the bill
Senate decides whether the bill can be passed to the House

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a qualification for governor?

choices.answer: Must be at least 30 years old
Meet at least 5 celebrities per year
Be a U.S citizen for at least 15 years
Legal resident of Georgia for 6 years before election

questions.question: What type of system does Georgia have?
What is the purpose of executive branch departments such as Board of Pardons and Paroles?

choices.answer: Plan an annual dinner with the president and past presidents
To set policies and oversee executive departments

questions.question: What is the difference between criminal and civil law?

choices.answer: Civil-serious crime/Criminal-carries a less severe penalty

questions.question: Which of these is NOT one of the courts in the court system?
What is a booking?

choices.answer: Official record of arrest and place suspects in holding cell
A formal accusation of a serious crime
A method to show how to "book" a interview

questions.question: What is a juvenile delinquent?

choices.answer: Child who commits an act that isn't committed by an adult
A child under age 17 who commits an act and needs treatment
A child who is without food, shelter, and protection
A kid that watches YouTube all day

questions.question: Which is NOT an example of a right for juveniles?

choices.answer: Have the right to present a defense
Must be notified of charges against them

questions.question: What is the term used to describe a form of punishment in certain cases?
What is an unincorporated area?

choices.answer: Part of the county that's not included in any city boundary
Provide services for residents as long as it's not violated

questions.question: What is the responsibility of the judge of the probate court?

choices.answer: Establish county policies and adopt county ordinances
Oversees matters such as marriage licenses and wills

questions.question: What is the strong mayor-council form?

choices.answer: When the mayor mocks the residents of its state
Mayor is responsible for oversees state laws
